etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French gramaire, via Latin from Greek grammatikē (tekhnē) ‘(art) of letters’, from gramma, grammat- ‘letter of the alphabet, thing written’

definitions: the whole system and structure of a language or of languages in general, usually taken as consisting of syntax and morphology (including inflections) and sometimes also phonology and semantics.
shortDefinitions: whole system and structure of language

definitions: a particular analysis of the system and structure of language or of a specific language.
shortDefinitions: particular analysis of system and structure of language

definitions: a set of actual or presumed prescriptive notions about correct use of a language

examples.text: it was not bad grammar, just dialect

shortDefinitions: set of prescriptive notions about correct use of language

definitions: the basic elements of an area of knowledge or skill
shortDefinitions: basic elements of area of knowledge etc.

definitions: a set of rules governing what strings are valid or allowable in a language or text.
shortDefinitions: rules governing what strings are valid in language or text
